title: Freeware games
content:
I thought it'd be a good idea if there was a topic about good freeware games. If you found a good freeware game somewhere, why not mention it here and give us all some fun? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Okay, my current freeware recommendations are:

The Underside (currently only a demo available) - [url=http://www.superfundungeonrun.com/insignificantstudios/preview.php]www.superfundungeonrun.co...review.php[/url]
Very good platform game, somewhat RPG-ish. I love it.

ClickBeat - [url=http://www.thephorse.net/beatclick/news/]www.thephorse.net/beatclick/news/[/url]
All about rhytm here. A stealthy game where you have to click the small circles that appear. In the meantime it's guided by music and background animation (very arty).

I'll post the best new freeware games I know of every once in a while for you people to enjoy. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________

title: Re: Freeware games
content:
[url=http://www.freelunchdesign.com]Free Lunch Design[/url] made some very nice Allegro-based games, though unfortunately they never took advantage of its cross-platform capability.

[url=http://generally.rscsites.org/]GeneRally[/url] makes for some mindless fun, and it runs on lower end computers. Browsing that site just now, it looks like there's a bit of a community happening there as well.

[url=http://jet.ro/feats]Jetro[/url] made some very tasty little games, too. Check out Stair Dismount (Porrasturvat) and Truck Dismount (Rekkaturvat) in particular. Racing Pitch looks rather comical, but I've not tried it yet.

And let's not forget [url=http://www.adeptsoftware.com/classics/]Adept Software[/url], with Jetpack, Squarez and God of Thunder.

title: Re: Freeware games
content:
I have another couple to add to the list.

[url=http://www.naked-war.com/]Naked War[/url] is a comically entertaining two-player turn-based strategy game, mixing a classic tilemap style with 3D landscapes and interface. Free to play as much as you want, with the option of purchasing a registered version to join the community and play online (as far as I understand it).

[url=http://www.trackmanianations.com/]TrackMania Nations[/url] In case you haven't played TrackMania, it's more or less a modern day incarnation of Stunts. There are, if I'm not mistaken, three commercial games currently available, but this one is completely free to download and play solo or online on a wide range of servers.

I definitely recommend it as long as your hardware can handle it. If not, try turning down the settings and imagine it's an oldschool game. Although the graphics are indeed stunning, the gameplay is what makes it really shine.

Finally...

[url=http://www.pompomgames.com/]PomPom Games[/url] have some brilliant modern classics available. Although they're commercial games, the demos available are very enjoyable, and for $10 they're definitely worth supporting--especially since they're available for Windows, Linux and Mac!

title: Re: Freeware games
content:
Ah, freeware.

I highly recommend [url=http://www.konjak.org/main.htm]Konjak's[/url] games, especially Chalk. It's the most innovative game I've played in ages, and is loads of fun. Tripline is a neat little puzzle game that'll last you a while. Noitu Love is a beat-em-up with fairly shallow gameplay but some really outstanding bosses.

Also, Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory well worth a try. Not only is it fairly modern and free, it's one of the best multiplayer FPS experiences you'll ever find.
